content.description:
NO SWEAT ARETE 5.6 ** (75') F (8b)

A fun well protected climb up the arête left of the main Narrows buttress. Approach from  the brushy gully, and belay atop the large blocks (single bolt belay). Step up and right onto the arête and climb it to the 2 chain anchors above the top ledge. For top-roping a long cordelette is recommended to avoid the sharp edge below the top ledge.
content.protection: fixed 8 bolts, 2 chain anchors on top.
content.location: The left side of the narrows (the arete up and back from the trail beginning up the brushy gully at the top of the 2 huge boulders - single bolt belay anchor). A bit of a bushwhack to approach...

content.description:
THE NARROWS DIRECT 5.8 ** 95' M (3b)

Begin about 5' right of the Arête route and climb the middle of the face. Shares the top anchors with the Arête route. Middle gear protected crux section is fantastic! Take a wide range of cams or nuts to protect.
content.protection: mixed, wide range of cams needed
content.location: climbs the middle of the main face

content.description:
THE NARROWS ARETE 5.9 *** 95' F (8b)

Climbs the prominent south arête, on excellent rock, through three progressively harder, varied (and better) cruxes. 2 ring anchors at the top.
content.location: climbs the arete on the left edge of the main face.
